moves.1. d4: This was a mini tournament game starting as Queen' s Gambit Accepted.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. Nf3 f6: The computer analyses computes e6 as a better move. I liked this to restrain his knight on f3.
moves.4. e4 e5 5. a3 c5 6. d5 b5 7. Be3 a5: The computer states this as a mistake preferring a6. I wanted to drive my queen-side pawns and disrupt his initiative.
moves.8. Nc3 Ba6 9. Na2 b4 10. axb4 cxb4 11. Q: Enticing a ds bishop trade for a nice placement of my knight currently on d7.
moves.14. O-O c3 15. Bxa6 Rxa6: The analysis says that cxb2 would have been better. This may be accurate, but I felt my pawn on c3 would be picked off eventually. I left it hanging for the sake of retaining initiative.
moves.16. bxc3 b3 17. Nd2 bxa2 18. Bxc5: Finally! I've been waiting to take c5 with my knight for a while.
moves.18... Nxc5 19. Rxa2 Ne7 20. c4 f5: Setting up my knight and opening a file for my rook after castling.
moves.21. exf5 Nxf5 22. Re1 Nd3 23. Rea1 Rg6 2: I did this to keep his king from e2.
At this point I had to turn my game over to my 8 yr old because I had traveled from America to Nigeria. Gameknot blocked my access while in Nigeria. Also my email that was attached to my Gameknot account was blocked as well so I could not reset my password. Not wishing to default I asked my boy, who is a fairly strong player for an 8 year old, to finish my game.
moves.33... Ne2 34. Re3 Ng1+: My little guy made the best move here!
moves.36. Kxh5 Nxe3 37. fxe3 Rxe4 38. c6 Re5+: I'm proud of my boy for finishing the game for me and not letting it go. Since I could not finish as I was overseas, my 8 year old thought about his moves and made the best ones!
